sentences.sContent: This is a well-known nursery rhyme.
sentences.sCn: 这是一支大家都很熟悉的童谣。

sentences.sContent: Now many people might think that I was only joking when in one of my articles lately I said that reading the English nursery rhyme about Taffy the Welshman could help to educate the soul of a man.
sentences.sCn: 余新近写有一文，曰，读威尔士人泰菲所作之英语童谣，有益于教化人之心灵。 览此文者，多以为，此乃玩笑而已。

sentences.sContent: “In 1492 Columbus sailed the ocean blue” is how the children’s nursery rhyme begins.
sentences.sCn: “1492年，哥伦布在蓝色海洋上乘风破浪”，这成为孩子们童谣的开头曲。

trans.tranOther: a short traditional poem or song for children
